snippet: The Internet company says it will host daily and one-week fantasy games, joining a market estimated to generate $2.6 billion in revenue this year.
abstract: Yahoo says it will host daily and one-week fantasy sports games played for money, beginning with Major League Baseball and expanding to other professional sports as their seasons commence; increasingly lucrative legalized betting industry is expected to have 2015 revenue of $2.6 billion.

byline.original: By VINDU GOEL and JOE DRAPE
byline.contributor: Vindu Goel reported from San Francisco, and Joe Drape from New York.

lead_paragraph: The Internet company says it will host daily and one-week fantasy games, joining a market estimated to generate $2.6 billion in revenue this year.

headline.main: Yahoo Will Enter Daily Fantasy Sports Market
headline.print_headline: Yahoo Makes a Big Entrance Into Fantasy Sports Betting
